message.content:
Let's call the present age of your sister "x". When you were 6 years old, your sister's age was half of your age at that time. So, when you were 6, your sister's age was:

(6 years old for you) / 2 = (x years old for your sister) / 2

Simplify the equation:

3x = 12

Divide both sides by 3 to find x:

x = 4

Your sister is currently 4 years old.

Alternatively, you can also use a time-line approach. When you were 6, your sister was born. Now, at age 80, you have been alive for 74 more years (80 - 6 = 74). During this time, your sister has grown up to be 4 years old. Therefore, she must have been born when you were 6 - 74 = -68 years old. However, since we cannot have a negative age, we know that your sister's birth year was actually 68 years ago (when you were 6). So, her current age is 4 years old.

I hope this helps clarify the calculation! Let me know if you have any other questions.
